alert.note: Alert for Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Grant Grove Area; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kings Canyon NP; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; Sequoia NP; South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 05 at 1:56PM PST until March 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 inches to 3 feet. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph over the crest and exposed ridgetops. A few Thunderstorms are also possible through Sunday. * WHERE...Sierra Nevada mainly above 3,000 feet from Yosemite National Park to Sequoia National Park. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Monday. Snowfall rates will be heaviest late Saturday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
